tn.text: Ezekiel tells about a message that Yahweh gave him.
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:21:08]].
"Cry out with grief" This command is to Egypt and the nations around Egypt.
"That day is very frightening" or "Very bad things will happen on that day"
It was implied that "the day" was the time when the people would wail. Alternate translation: "It will soon be the day when you will wail." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: The day is near for Yahweh
tn.text: It is implied that on that day, Yahweh will punish people. Alternate translation: "It will soon be the day when Yahweh will punish people."
Alternate translations: "It will be like a day with dark clouds" or "It will be frightening like a day with dark clouds." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]).

tn.ref: a time of doom for nations
tn.text: Alternate translations: "a time when terrible things will happen to the nations" or "It will be a time when the people of the nations will suffer"
These are Yahweh's words about Egypt.

tn.ref: Then a sword will come against Egypt
tn.text: The word "sword" here refers to war or an attack. Alternate translations: "There will be war against Egypt" or "An enemy army will attack Egypt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: there will be anguish in Cush
tn.text: "Cush will be very sad" or "the people of Cush will be full of grief"

tn.ref: when the killed people fall in Egypt
tn.text: "when many people in Egypt are killed" or "when many people in Egypt die in the war."
"The attackers will take away the wealth of Egypt"
"The attackers will even ruin the foundations of the buildings in Egypt"
Libya is a country west of Egypt. Ezekiel called this region Put. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This probably refers to the kingdom of Lydia which was in what is now Turkey. Ezekiel called this region Lud.

tn.ref: the people belonging to the covenant
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "the Jews who live in Egypt" or 2) "the other people in the lands of Egypt's allies." It is unclear whether "the covenant" refers to the agreement that Yahweh made with the Israelites or to an agreement that Egypt made with other people groups.

tn.ref: will all fall by the sword
tn.text: "will all die in battle" or "will all die in the war." This does not mean that every single person will die, but that many people from all of these countries will die.
"This is what Yahweh says." This sentence introduces what the Lord would say.
"In this way, the peoples" or "In this manner, the nations"
"who help Egypt"
"will die" or "come to ruin"

tn.ref: the pride of her strength will go down
tn.text: "the strength of Egypt, which made it proud, will be gone" or "the strength that made Egypt proud will come to ruin"

Ezekiel names towns on the borders of Egypt in order to refer to all of Egypt. Alternate translation: "In all of Egypt" or "From the northern border of Egypt to the southern border of Egypt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: their soldiers will fall by the sword
tn.text: "Egypt's soldiers will die by the sword." Alternate translation: "the attacking army will kill the soldiers of Egypt in battle."

tn.ref: They will be appalled in the midst of the abandoned lands
tn.text: "The soldiers of the allies of Egypt will be appalled when they are left surrounded by nothing but abandoned lands"
"among" or "surrounded by"

tn.ref: their cities will be among all the ruined cities
tn.text: "their cities will be surrounded by ruined cities in nearby nations"
These are Yahweh's words about Egypt.
Possible meanings are 1) "Then people" or 2) "Then the Egyptians."

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: when I set fire in Egypt
tn.text: Fire refers to the fires that often occurs in war. Alternate translation: "when I destroy Egypt with fire" or "when I send an attacking army to burn Egypt with fire." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: all of her helpers are destroyed
tn.text: Alternate translation: "I destroy all of the allies of Egypt" or "I break all those who help Egypt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: messengers will go out from before me in ships to terrorize a secure Cush
tn.text: Messengers will bring the news of Egypt's destruction to Cush, who will be frightened by the news.
"in order to frighten Cush, who now feels safe from danger"

tn.ref: there will be anguish among them on the day of Egypt's doom
tn.text: "the people of Cush will also have great pain when I punish Egypt"
The word "behold" here adds emphasis to what follows. It can also be translated as "indeed!"
"It" refers to the "great pain" or "great sorrow" that Cush will have when they are punished along with Egypt.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:05|5:5]].

tn.ref: I will make an end of the multitudes of Egypt
tn.text: Alternate translation: "I will make it so that Egypt will no longer have many people."
Nebuchadnezzar will be the one who brings this punishment about.

tn.ref: He and his army with him ... will be brought to destroy the land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will bring Nebuchadnezzar and his army ... to destroy the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He and his army with him, the terror of nations
tn.text: Yahweh calls Nebuchadnezzar "the terror of the nations" because all of the nations are greatly afraid of his army.
"so they will destroy the land." Yahweh will bring Nebuchadnezzar and his people so that they will destroy the land.

tn.ref: draw out their swords against Egypt
tn.text: "fight against Egypt"

tn.ref: fill the land with dead people
tn.text: This is an exaggeration to show that the Babylonians will kill very many Egyptians. There will be so many dead Egyptians that it will seem that their dead bodies cover all of the land of Egypt. Alternate translation: "they will kill so many people that it will seem like their dead bodies are everywhere" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]]).
These are Yahweh's words about Egypt.

tn.ref: I will make the rivers into dry ground
tn.text: "I will dry up the rivers of Egypt"

tn.ref: I will sell the land into the hand of wicked men
tn.text: Yahweh will give the Babylonians control over Egypt just as a person who sells something gives the one who buys it control over that thing. Alternate translation: "I will give control of the land to wicked men." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will make the land and its fullness desolate by the hand of strangers
tn.text: "I will cause people from another nation to destroy the land and everything in it"
"everything in the land"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:05:05|5:5]].

tn.ref: bring an end to the worthless idols
tn.text: "destroy the useless idols"
Memphis was a very important city in Egypt. It was near modern-day Cairo. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: a prince in the land of Egypt
tn.text: "an important ruler in the land of Egypt"

tn.ref: I will put terror on the land of Egypt
tn.text: "I will make the people of Egypt very afraid"
This was a region in southern Egypt.
"I will burn Zoan with fire"
Zoan was another important city in Egypt.
This was the capital city of southern Egypt.
These are Yahweh's words about Egypt.

tn.ref: For I will pour out my fury on Pelusium
tn.text: "For I will act in anger against Pelusium" or "Because I am so angry, I will punish Pelusium severely"
This was an important city in northern Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: cut off the multitude of Thebes
tn.text: "kill the very large number of people in Thebes"
See how you translated the name of this city in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:30:13|3:14]].

tn.ref: Then I will set fire in Egypt
tn.text: "I will burn Egypt with fire"
"will be in great pain" or "will feel great pain"
"Thebes will be destroyed." Alternate translation: "Enemies will conquer Thebes." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
See how you translated the name of this city in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:30:13|30:13]].

tn.ref: Memphis will have enemies every day
tn.text: Alternate translation: "The people of Memphis will be worried every day"
These are Yahweh's words about Egypt.
These were cities in northern Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "sword" is used here to refer to a battle or war. Alternate translation: "will die in battle" or "will die in the war." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: their cities will go into captivity
tn.text: "the people of their cities will become captives" or "the people will be taken away as prisoners."
This was an important city in northern Egypt.

tn.ref: the day will hold back its light
tn.text: The day is spoken of as if it were able to keep its own light from shining. AT: "the day will be dark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: when I break the yoke of Egypt there
tn.text: The word "yoke" here refers to Egypt's power to oppress people. Alternate translation: "when I stop Egypt from oppressing people" or "when I end Egypt's power to cruelly control other nations."

tn.ref: the pride of her strength will be finished
tn.text: "Egypt will not be proud of being strong anymore" or "that country will no longer be proud of being strong" (UDB)

tn.ref: There will be a cloud covering her
tn.text: "A cloud will be over Egypt" or "It will be as if there is a cloud over Egypt." Possible meanings are 1) the dark cloud represents how sad the people of Egypt will feel, or 2) there will be a cloud of dust over Egypt from everything that is destroyed.
Possible meanings are 1) the people of the Egyptian towns or 2) the daughters of the Egyptian people

tn.ref: I will execute acts of judgment in Egypt
tn.text: "I will punish Egypt in many ways"
"so the Egyptians"

tn.ref: will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].
This phrase is used here to mark the beginning of a new part of the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:26:01|26:1]].

tn.ref: in the first month, in the seventh day of the month
tn.text: "in the seventh day of the first month." This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The seventh day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].
Here "arm" represents the power of a king. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "Behold" here alerts us to pay attention to the surprising information that follows.

tn.ref: It is not bound up and able to receive medicine
tn.text: AT: "His arm is not wrapped up and it does not have medicine on so it can heal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
a soft piece of cloth that people put on wounds so that they will heal

tn.ref: so it will not be strong enough to grasp a sword
tn.text: Here "sword" represents the power of a king in war. AT: "so his arm will not be strong enough to use a sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:10|3:11]].

tn.ref: both the strong one and the broken one
tn.text: "both the arm that is healthy and the arm that is already broken"

tn.ref: I will make the sword fall from his hand
tn.text: "I will knock the sword out of the Pharaoh's hand"

tn.ref: scatter Egypt among the nations and disperse them among the lands
tn.text: See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:20:23|20:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"countries"

tn.ref: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon
tn.text: "I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong"

tn.ref: He will groan before the king of Babylon
tn.text: When the king of Babylon comes to attack Egypt, Pharaoh will groan.
A groan is a loud noise that people make when they have a lot of pain or are dying.

tn.ref: with the groans of a dying man
tn.text: "as a man who is dying groans" or "like a man who is dying"

tn.ref: For I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon
tn.text: "I will make the arms of the king of Babylon strong."
"but Pharaoh will not be able to use his arms" or "Pharaoh's arms will be so weak that he cannot use them"
The word "they" possibly refers to 1) "the Egyptians" or 2) "all people who hear what Yahweh has done."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: for he will attack the land of Egypt with it
tn.text: "and the king of Babylon will attack the land of Egypt with my sword"

tn.ref: scatter Egypt among the nations and disperse them through the lands
tn.text: See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:20:23|20:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
